item.title: LemFi moves remittances further into Asia and Europe with $53M in new funding
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description:
For many emerging market economies, remittances have become a lifeline. Inflows surpassed $669 billion in 2023, according to World Bank research, and they now represent significant portions of GDP in these countries, often outpacing foreign direct investment as the primary source of foreign exchange.  Traditional banks and agents maintain a firm grip on the remittance […]

item.title: How Barcelona became an unlikely hub for spyware startups
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Barcelona's mix of affordable cost of living and quality of life has helped create a vibrant startup community — and become a hotbed for the creation of surveillance technologies.

item.title: China is reportedly open to Elon Musk acquiring TikTok US
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Chinese government officials have reportedly discussed a scenario where ByteDance sells TikTok’s United States arm to Elon Musk, should the Supreme Court uphold the law banning the app on January 19. Bloomberg reports that China would strongly prefer for TikTok to stay under ByteDance’s ownership, but says government officials have considered a sale to Musk […]

item.title: As TikTok faces a US shutdown, here are some alternative apps to check out
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
TikTok has warned of a looming shutdown in just six days, as the Supreme Court is currently weighing the law that would ban the app. So we thought it’s time to take a look at other platforms that may be able to fill the TikTok-shaped hole in our lives.  The law gives TikTok parent company […]

item.title: Robinhood agrees to pay $45M in SEC settlement
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Robinhood has agreed to fork out $45 million to settle an investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission over several alleged violations, reported the Wall Street Journal on Monday. The settlement is being made via two of Robinhood’s brokerage units. One of the violations relates to Robinhood’s November 2021 confirmation that it was hacked “with […]

item.title: Microsoft forms new internal dev-focused AI org
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Microsoft has created a new engineering organization aimed at accelerating AI infrastructure and software development within the company. According to Bloomberg, Jay Parikh, previously VP and global head of engineering at Meta, will lead the new division. He’ll report to Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and oversee groups, including the company’s AI platform and developer teams. […]

item.title: The CIA’s first CTO, Nand Mulchandani, prepares for the Trump administration
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
In April 2022, the CIA decided to swipe right on Nand Mulchandani, appointing him as its first-ever chief technology officer. It was a good look for the CIA. Mulchandani, who previously served as the CTO and acting director of the Defense Department’s Joint Artificial Intelligence Center, is something of a rare breed in Washington. Before […]

item.title: OpenAI presents its preferred version of AI regulation in a new ‘blueprint’
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI on Monday published what it’s calling an “economic blueprint” for AI: a living document that lays out policies the company thinks it can build on with the U.S. government and its allies. The blueprint, which includes a forward from Chris Lehane, OpenAI’s VP of global affairs, asserts that the U.S. must act to attract […]

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are slamming Meta over its fact-checking policy
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have joined the ranks of those displeased with Meta’s changes to fact-checking and have released a statement saying that the changes “directly undermines free speech.”  “Meta’s changes to its ‘Hateful Content Policies’ do not protect free expression but instead foster an environment where abuse and hate speech silence and threaten […]

item.title: Top New York VC Ben Lerer says more mid-sized VC firms are heading for failure
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Ben Lerer, managing partner of one of New York’s most prestigious seed-stage venture firms, Lerer Hippeau, shared some predictions with Fortune’s Leo Schwartz. He believes venture firms will continue to see a bifurcation as money pours mostly into top funds like Thrive and a16z, as well as into smaller more bespoke funds.  “Where you go […]

item.title: The first AI chip startup to go public in 2025 will be Blaize
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
Blaize, an AI chip manufacturer founded by former Intel engineers, is set to IPO on the NASDAQ on January 14.

item.title: ‘Free Our Feeds’ campaign aims to billionaire-proof Bluesky’s tech
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
As Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg continue to reshape the social media space, a group of international tech entrepreneurs and advocates has launched a campaign to protect social media from the control and influence of billionaires. The initiative, Free Our Feeds, aims to protect Bluesky’s underlying technology, the AT Protocol, and leverage it to create […]

item.title: Raspberry AI raises $24M from a16z to accelerate fashion design
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
The world of fashion is moving at a faster pace each year. Most retailers introduce new styles each season, and fast-fashion companies like Shein, H&M, and Zara update their collections continuously. To keep pace with the rapid demand for new styles, brands and manufacturers have been turning to tech to accelerate their design process. Raspberry […]

item.title: A 24-year-old who exited his first company to Coinbase raises $3M for his next venture
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
At 24 years old, Pryce Yebesi already has one exit: selling his crypto invoicing company Utopia Labs to Coinbase for an undisclosed amount.  Some founders don’t just have one company in them. On Monday, Yebesi announced the launch of his new company, Open Ledger, which embeds automated accounting software into products that enterprises and small […]

item.title: Clearwater agrees to buy investment management platform Enfusion for $1.5B
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Clearwater Analytics, a company developing accounting, compliance, and risk reporting tools for asset managers, said on Monday it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire investment management platform Enfusion for $1.5 billion. Clearwater, which says it has obtained an $800 million loan to fund the transaction, along with a $200 million revolving line of […]

item.title: Biden administration proposes sweeping new restrictions on exporting AI chips
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
With a week left in office, President Joe Biden introduced a new set of guidelines and restrictions for exporting U.S.-made AI chips. On Monday the administration announced its Interim Final Rule on AI diffusion. This ruling is meant to “provide clarity to allied and partner nations about how they can benefit from AI” and streamline […]

item.title: Biden admin snubs Tesla’s $100 million big-rig charging funding request — again
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
The Department of Transportation announced Friday another $636 million in funding that will be awarded to 49 applicants for electric-vehicle charging infrastructure — and Tesla’s application for nearly $100 million to fund a big-rig charging corridor was once again passed over. Tesla’s name was not among the list of recipients released, and its partner on the […]

item.title: Xiaohongshu, China’s answer to Instagram, hits No. 1 on the App Store as TikTok faces US shutdown
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
On the heels of TikTok’s looming shut down on January 19 over its ownership in the U.S. (unless the Supreme Court intervenes), it looks like another Chinese app is catching some attention. American users are flocking to Chinese short-form video app Xiaohongshu (known as RedNote in English). The app today surged to the No. 1 […]

item.title: Blue Origin delays launch of New Glenn mega-rocket
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Jeff Bezos’ space company Blue Origin postponed the inaugural launch of its first orbital rocket, New Glenn, early Monday morning after experiencing an unspecified issue with one of the vehicle’s subsystems. While delays like this happen all the time in spaceflight, this one once again puts the timing of the much-anticipated launch in question. According […]

item.title: Moody’s agrees to acquire Cape Analytics, which develops geospatial AI for insurance providers
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Financial services firm Moody’s announced on Monday that it has agreed to acquire Cape Analytics, a geospatial AI startup, for an undisclosed sum. The deal, which is expected to close in Q1, subject to customary closing conditions, will give Moody’s access to Cape’s geospatial AI analytics technology for insurance underwriting. With the tech, Moody’s plans […]
